content: The following lists events that happened during **1974 in Singapore**. ## Incumbents - [President](/wiki/President_of_Singapore): [Benjamin Henry Sheares](/wiki/Benjamin_Henry_Sheares) - [Prime Minister](/wiki/Prime_Minister_of_Singapore): [Lee Kuan Yew](/wiki/Lee_Kuan_Yew) ## Events ### January - 26 January – The [Brani Naval Base](/wiki/Brani_Naval_Base) is officially opened as Singapore's first naval base. - 31 January – **[Laju incident](/wiki/Laju_incident)**: [Japanese Red Army](/wiki/Japanese_Red_Army) bombs petroleum tanks at [Pulau Bukom](/wiki/Pulau_Bukom) and hijacks a ferry boat. ### February - 15 February – The [Singapore Cable Car](/wiki/Singapore_Cable_Car) is officially opened to link up Mount Faber with Sentosa, making it the first system to span a [harbour](/wiki/Harbour). ### April - 1 April - - The Singapore Telephone Board merges into the Telecommunication Authority of Singapore, forming a single statutory board. This will streamline telecommunication services and increase efficiency. - The [Urban Redevelopment Authority](/wiki/Urban_Redevelopment_Authority) is formed to redevelop the [Central Area](/wiki/Central_Area,_Singapore). ### June - 25 June – [Temasek Holdings](/wiki/Temasek_Holdings) is formed to manage investments in government-linked companies (GLCs). ### July - 7 July - The [first colour TV programme](/wiki/Television_in_Singapore#Television_Singapura/Radio_and_Television_Singapore_(1963-1980)) is broadcast during the [1974 FIFA World Cup Final](/wiki/1974_FIFA_World_Cup_Final). ### August - 17 August – A second Satellite Earth Station with an antenna is launched at the [Sentosa Satellite Earth Station](/wiki/Sentosa_Satellite_Earth_Station). ## Births - 8 April – [Adam Khoo](/wiki/Adam_Khoo), entrepreneur, author, trainer, and stocks and FX trader - 16 May – [Beatrice Chia](/wiki/Beatrice_Chia), actress and director. - 24 June – [Andrea De Cruz](/wiki/Andrea_De_Cruz), actress. - 17 August – [Low Yen Ling](/wiki/Low_Yen_Ling), politician. - 15 September – [Zaqy Mohamad](/wiki/Zaqy_Mohamad), politician. - 28 September – [Gan Siow Huang](/wiki/Gan_Siow_Huang), politician and former brigadier-general. - [Corrinne May](/wiki/Corrinne_May), singer. ## Deaths - 16 March – [Thamizhavel G. Sarangapani](/wiki/Thamizhavel_G._Sarangapani), founder of [Tamil Murasu](/wiki/Tamil_Murasu) (b. 1903). This Singapore-related article is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it. - v - t - e This year in Asia article is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it. - v - t - e
title: 1974 in Singapore
